intro: Thonningia angolensis, commonly known as the Angola thonningia, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Thonningia angolensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky outcrops.
